div.p: S. D. We have received and read, most illustrious men, lords, fathers, and brothers in Christ to be revered, your letters given to us in recent days, in which you explain the reasons that have compelled you to consider appealing to the most illustrious princes of Germany at the upcoming imperial diet, if necessity so demands, with a joint letter composed by the most illustrious man, Lord Josias Simler, our lord and brother in Christ to be honored, and communicated to us, etc.
To the most illustrious man and our father in Christ to be most revered, Mr. Bullinger, we sincerely pray for strength of faith and constancy and offer our constant prayers to the Lord on his behalf.
Farewell in Christ, most revered lords and brothers. Schaffhausen, August 18, in the year of our Lord 1575.
Your most devoted ministers of the Church of Schaffhausen.
